title: Copper Col
text: Copper Col () is a <a href="col">col</a> at 305 m, between <a href="Copper%20Peak%20%28Antarctica%29">Copper Peak</a> and <a href="Billie%20Peak">Billie Peak</a> in the <a href="Osterrieth%20Range">Osterrieth Range</a> of <a href="Anvers%20Island">Anvers Island</a>, in the <a href="Palmer%20Archipelago">Palmer Archipelago</a>. Probably first seen by the <a href="Belgian%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Belgian Antarctic Expedition</a> (1897-99), under <a href="Adrien%20de%20Gerlache">Adrien de Gerlache</a>. The name "Copper Glacier" appears in this position on a chart based on a 1927 survey by <a href="Discovery%20Investigations">Discovery Investigations</a> personnel on the "<a href="RRS%20Discovery">RRS Discovery</a>". The feature was resurveyed in 1955 by the <a href="Falklands%20Islands%20Dependencies%20Survey">Falklands Islands Dependencies Survey</a>, who reported that col would be a better descriptive term.
